statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Idaho State 68, Utah Valley State 67
article.story: OREM, Utah (AP) -- David Schroeder scored 19 points to lead Idaho State to a 68-67 victory over Utah Valley State Tuesday night. The Wolverines (14-13) led 60-58 with less than two minutes remaining, but the Bengals scored six straight points to go ahead by four. Akbar Abdul-Ahad was 6-for-6 from the free throw line in the final 20 seconds to help Idaho State (12-13) preserve its lead. Twice in the final six seconds, UVSC had a chance to tie the score by making a 3-pointer. But both times the Wolverines hit two-point baskets. Schroeder scored 13 of his 19 points in the second half and shot 3-for-4 from beyond the arc. Kasey Winters added 15 points and 12 rebounds for the Bengals. Pierre Thomas led Utah Valley with 13 points and five assists. After Abdul-Ahad sank two free throws with 5.4 seconds remaining to put Idaho State ahead 66-63, the Wolverines quickly advanced the ball upcourt to Richard Troyer. Instead of passing to a wide open teammate in the left corner, Troyer instead took the uncontested layup even though less than two seconds remained in the game. Abdul-Ahad made another pair of free throws with 0.8 seconds left on the clock for a 68-65 advantage. Peter Brown heaved an inbounds pass the length of the court to Thomas, whose shot at the buzzer counted. But because Thomas was in the key and not beyond the 3-point line, the basket only netted two points and the Wolverines lost by one.
